Content: 5.1.1 mechanical signature, of an instrument — that component of a measurement that is introduced by the instrument and that is systematic, repeatable, and quantifiable. 5.1.2 median surface, of a semiconductor wafer — the locus of points equidistant from the front and back surfaces of the wafer. 5.1.3 reference plane, of a semiconductor wafer — a plane from which deviations of a specified surface of the wafer are measured. 5.1.4 reference plane deviation (RPD) — the distance from a point on a reference plane to the corresponding point on a wafer surface. 5.1.4.1 Discussion — The front surface of a domeshaped wafer is considered to have positive RPD at its center; the front surface of a bowl-shaped wafer is considered to have negative RPD at its center. 5.1.5 sori, of a semiconductor wafer — the algebraic difference between the most positive and the most negative deviations of the front surface of a wafer that is not chucked from a reference plane that is a least squares fit to the front surface.
